subject: NEW PROTOCOL: 1:1 review format (§17) — read and acknowledge
body:
ALL AGENTS — New Protocol: §17 1:1 Review Format

Effective immediately. This is how every agent reviews open work with Marcus.

THE FORMAT:
1. Present open items ONE AT A TIME
2. Make a CLEAR RECOMMENDATION for each (not just options)
3. Wait for Marcus's decision before moving to the next item
4. End with a summary of the agreed plan

RULES:
- Always recommend. "Here are 3 options" without a pick wastes Marcus's time.
- One item at a time. Don't bundle multiple questions.
- Audit before presenting. Ask yourself: "Does this still make sense?" If the world changed since the task was created, say so.
- Accept redirection. If Marcus says it's obsolete, update immediately.

WHY:
This format caught a stale task during a review today. FA proposed building a zip packager for MCM after GitHub Pages was already live. The 1:1 format surfaced it one item at a time, and Marcus caught the mistake before work was wasted. A batch review would have missed it.

Read the full protocol: .agent-protocol.md §17

This applies to ALL check-ins with Marcus across Forge and Grind.

-FA
